e4: Adopting the new policy enhances ethical standards by ensuring financial reports are accurate and truthful, which aligns with regulatory requirements and reduces potential legal liabilities. Although some investors might initially misunderstand, in the long term, this transparency fosters trust and strengthens the firm's reputation among all investor classes.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure accuracy, transparency, and fairness, providing clear, unbiased financial information. It should comply with legal standards and prioritize long-term credibility over short-term gains. Additionally, it should be comprehensible to all investors, reducing information asymmetry and ensuring retail investors are not disadvantaged compared to institutional investors.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to ensure understanding across all investor types and what measures will be implemented to monitor and mitigate any market misunderstandings during the transition period.
